document.title: GABA<sub>B</sub> Receptor Stimulation Phase-shifts the Mammalian Circadian Clock In Vitro

keywords.keyword: Circadian rhythms; Suprachiasmatic nucleus; Î³-aminobutyric acid; GABA; Baclofen; Rat; Brain-slice

document.abstract: The mammalian circadian clock in the suprachiasmatic nucleus (SCN) generates 24-h rhythms in vitro. Here we show that the GABAB agonist baclofen resets the SCN pacemaker in vitro in a phase-dependent manner: advances were induced at zeitgeber time (ZT) 6, and delays were induced at ZT 22. Both effects were blocked the GABAB antagonist, 2-hydroxysaclofen, while the GABAA antagonist, bicuculline was ineffective. Thus, the SCN pacemaker is sensitive to resetting by GABAB stimulation.
